q: In his own statement, Mr Andy Coulson said coverage of events connected to his former job made it difficult for him to "give the 110 per cent needed". He said: Nothing is more important than the Government's task of getting this country back on its feet. "Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 per cent needed in this role. "I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman it's time to move on. Â© News Group Newspapers Ltd. American Civil Liberties Union has uncovered thousands of pages of government documents that show that torture was authorized at the highest levels of the Bush administration. Jameel Jaffer , Deputy Legal Director of the ACLU: Mr. Donald Rumsfeld 's claim that the abuse at Abu Ghraib was isolated and aberrational is demonstrably false. Government documents show that the methods used at Abu Ghraib were the same ones Mr. Donald Rumsfeld approved, and that the abuse of prisoners in Defense Department custody was systemic. If there's any "known known,' it"s that Donald Rumsfeld joined with other officials to orchestrate a program of torture. This effort to rewrite history is shameful.
